means: 敲出和谐的乐声( chime的第三人称单数 )

sentence.Network_en: The chimes of the huge bell rang in the New Year.
sentence.Network_cn: 大钟的钟声迎来了新的一年.

sentence.Network_en: He has managed to find a response to each new political development that chimes in with most Germans' instinct.
sentence.Network_cn: 他终于在针对每场新的政治变革的反应中发现了与大多数德国人的本能反应相吻合的一种。

sentence.Network_en: The second one chimes in: I'm sick of it all.
sentence.Network_cn: 第二个人说: 活腻味了.

entry.def: When a bell or a clock chimes, it makes ringing sounds.

example.ex: He heard the front doorbell chime.
...as the Guildhall clock chimed three o'clock.
example.tran: 市政厅的大钟敲响3点的时候

entry.def: A chime is a ringing sound made by a bell, especially when it is part of a clock.

example.ex: At that moment a chime sounded from the front of the house...
example.tran: 就在那时，房前传来一声铃。

example.ex: The ceremony started as the chimes of midnight struck.
example.tran: 子夜钟声响起的时候，仪式开始了。

entry.def: Chimes are a set of small objects which make a ringing sound when they are blown by the wind.

example.ex: ...the haunting sound of the wind chimes.

auth_sentence.content: Downstairs the doorbell gave out its jaunty chimes.
auth_sentence.res_content: Downstairs the doorbell gave out its jaunty chimes.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Downstairs the doorbell gave out its jaunty chimes.

auth_sentence.content: Larger bamboo canes are great for making wind chimes with.
auth_sentence.res_content: Larger bamboo canes are great for making wind chimes with.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Larger bamboo canes are great for making wind chimes with.

auth_sentence.content: I commend the Chimes for doing it the right way.
auth_sentence.res_content: I commend the Chimes for doing it the right way.
